t: Luke 16
The Parable of the Dishonest Manager
Now*p he said to the disciples, “There*r was*r a*r rich*r man*r who*r received*r an*r accusation*r that*r his*r manager*r was*r squandering*r his*r possessions.*r

So*r he*r called*r the*r manager*r in*r and*r asked,*r ‘What*r is*r this*r I*r hear*r about*r you?*r Give*r an*r account*r of*r your*r management,*r because*r you*r can*r no*r longer*r be*r my*r manager.’*r

“Then*rp the*r manager*r said*r to*r himself,*r ‘What*r will*r I*r do*r since*r my*r master*r is*r taking*r the*r management*r away*r from*r me?*r I’m*r not*r strong*r enough*r to*r dig;*r I’m*r ashamed*r to*r beg.*r
I*r know*r what*r I’ll*r do*r so*r that*r when*r I’m*r removed*r from*r management,*r people*r will*r welcome*r me*r into*r their*r homes.’*r
“So*rp he*r summoned*r each*r one*r of*r his*r master’s*r debtors.*r ‘How*r much*r do*r you*r owe*r my*r master? ’*r he*r asked*r the*r first*r one.*r
“‘A*rp hundred*r measures*r of*r olive*r oil,’*r he*r said.*r “‘Take*rp your*r invoice,’*r he*r told*r him,*r ‘sit*r down*r quickly,*r and*r write*r fifty.’*r
“Next*rp he*r asked*r another,*r ‘How*r much*r do*r you*r owe?’*r “‘A*rp hundred*r measures*r of*r wheat,’*r he*r said.*r “‘Take*rp your*r invoice,’*r he*r told*r him,*r ‘and*r write*r eighty.’*r

“The*rp master*r praised*r the*r unrighteous*r manager*r because*r he*r had*r acted*r shrewdly.*r For*r the*r children*r of*r this*r age*r are*r more*r shrewd*r than*r the*r children*r of*r light*r in*r dealing*r with*r their*r own*r people.*r
And*r I*r tell*r you,*r make*r friends*r for*r yourselves*r by*r means*r of*r worldly*r wealth*r so*r that*r when*r it*r fails,*r they*r may*r welcome*r you*r into*r eternal*r dwellings.*r
Whoever*r is*r faithful*r in*r very*r little*r is*r also*r faithful*r in*r much,*r and*r whoever*r is*r unrighteous*r in*r very*r little*r is*r also*r unrighteous*r in*r much.*r
So*r if*r you*r have*r not*r been*r faithful*r with*r worldly*r wealth,*r who*r will*r trust*r you*r with*r what*r is*r genuine?*r
And*r if*r you*r have*r not*r been*r faithful*r with*r what*r belongs*r to*r someone*r else,*r who*r will*r give*r you*r what*r is*r your*r own?*r

No*r servant*r can*r serve*r two*r masters,*r since*r either*r he*r will*r hate*r one*r and*r love*r the*r other,*r or*r he*r will*r be*r devoted*r to*r one*r and*r despise*r the*r other.*r You*r cannot*r serve*r both*r God*r and*r money.”*r
Kingdom Values
The*p Pharisees, who were lovers of money, were listening to all these things and scoffing at him.

And he told them, “You*r are*r the*r ones*r who*r justify*r yourselves*r in*r the*r sight*r of*r others,*r but*r God*r knows*r your*r hearts.*r For*r what*r is*r highly*r admired*r by*r people*r is*r revolting*r in*r God’s*r sight.*r

“The*rp Law*r and*r the*r Prophets*r were*r until*r John;*r since*r then,*r the*r good*r news*r of*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God*r has*r been*r proclaimed,*r and*r everyone*r is*r urgently*r invited*r to*r enter*r it.*r
But*r it*r is*r easier*r for*r heaven*r and*r earth*r to*r pass*r away*r than*r for*r one*r stroke*r of*r a*r letter*r in*r the*r law*r to*r drop*r out.*r
“Everyone*rp who*r divorces*r his*r wife*r and*r marries*r another*r woman*r commits*r adultery,*r and*r everyone*r who*r marries*r a*r woman*r divorced*r from*r her*r husband*r commits*r adultery.*r
The Rich Man and Lazarus
“There*rp was*r a*r rich*r man*r who*r would*r dress*r in*r purple*r and*r fine*r linen,*r feasting*r lavishly*r every*r day.*r
But*r a*r poor*r man*r named*r Lazarus,*r covered*r with*r sores,*r was*r lying*r at*r his*r gate.*r
He*r longed*r to*r be*r filled*r with*r what*r fell*r from*r the*r rich*r man’s*r table,*r but*r instead*r the*r dogs*r would*r come*r and*r lick*r his*r sores.*r
One*r day*r the*r poor*r man*r died*r and*r was*r carried*r away*r by*r the*r angels*r to*r Abraham’s*r side.*r The*r rich*r man*r also*r died*r and*r was*r buried.*r
And*r being*r in*r torment*r in*r Hades,*r he*r looked*r up*r and*r saw*r Abraham*r a*r long*r way*r off,*r with*r Lazarus*r at*r his*r side.*r

‘Father*r Abraham! ’*r he*r called*r out,*r ‘Have*r mercy*r on*r me*r and*r send*r Lazarus*r to*r dip*r the*r tip*r of*r his*r finger*r in*r water*r and*r cool*r my*r tongue,*r because*r I*r am*r in*r agony*r in*r this*r flame!’*r

“‘Son,’*rp Abraham*r said,*r ‘remember*r that*r during*r your*r life*r you*r received*r your*r good*r things,*r just*r as*r Lazarus*r received*r bad*r things,*r but*r now*r he*r is*r comforted*r here,*r while*r you*r are*r in*r agony.*r

Besides*r all*r this,*r a*r great*r chasm*r has*r been*r fixed*r between*r us*r and*r you,*r so*r that*r those*r who*r want*r to*r pass*r over*r from*r here*r to*r you*r cannot;*r neither*r can*r those*r from*r there*r cross*r over*r to*r us.’*r
“‘Father,’*rp he*r said,*r ‘then*r I*r beg*r you*r to*r send*r him*r to*r my*r father’s*r house -*r
because*r I*r have*r five*r brothers -*r to*r warn*r them,*r so*r that*r they*r won’t*r also*r come*r to*r this*r place*r of*r torment.’*r
“But*rp Abraham*r said,*r ‘They*r have*r Moses*r and*r the*r prophets;*r they*r should*r listen*r to*r them.’*r
“‘No,*rp father*r Abraham,’*r he*r said.*r ‘But*r if*r someone*r from*r the*r dead*r goes*r to*r them,*r they*r will*r repent.’*r
“But*rp he*r told*r him,*r ‘If*r they*r don’t*r listen*r to*r Moses*r and*r the*r prophets,*r they*r will*r not*r be*r persuaded*r if*r someone*r rises*r from*r the*r dead.’”*r
